metadata.title: Green Building Requirements — AB-093 Implementation & GS Form Decision Logic
metadata.source: Administrative Bulletin AB-093: Implementation of Green Building Regulations (2022 SFGBC, eff. Jan 1 2023, rev. Dec 13 2023)
notes: Extracted from tier3/AB-093.txt full text + existing tier1/title24-energy-compliance.json + tier1/permit-forms-taxonomy.json
AB-093 is the master implementation bulletin for the 2022 SF Green Building Code
Effective dates: Jan 1, 2023 through Dec 31, 2025 (this version)
Green building requirements apply based on permit application date, not construction date
M-03, M-04, M-06, M-08 info sheets (referenced in GAP-12) were NOT downloaded but their content is captured in title24-energy-compliance.json
Signed by Patrick O'Riordan, C.B.O., Director DBI, 4/16/2024
Original version approved by Building Inspection Commission on 9/24/2008, revision approved 12/13/2023

applicable_codes.state_base: 2022 California Green Building Standards Code (CALGreen, Title 24 Part 11)
applicable_codes.energy_code: California Building Energy Efficiency Standards (Title 24 Part 6)
applicable_codes.note: SFGBC combines all mandatory CALGreen elements plus stricter local requirements. 'Locally required measures' = CALGreen prescriptive + local amendments + other local requirements.

applicability_by_code_year.description: Green building requirements apply based on permit application filing date. Site permits use original filing date, not addendum date.
applicability_by_code_year.site_permit_rule: For Site Permits, the effective date is the date the Site Permit application (not an addendum) is filed. Addenda use the original filing date unless scope changes trigger current codes.

gs_form_decision_logic.description: Decision logic for which GS (Green Building Submittal) form to use. Every building permit application must include the applicable GS form. DBI staff screen all applications to confirm which regulations apply per Attachment A, Table 1.

forms.name: Green Building Site Permit Submittal
forms.applies_to: All Site Permit applications subject to green building regulations
forms.required_at: Initial permit application — will NOT be accepted without GS-1
forms.note: Every Site Permit subject to green building must include GS-1. This is the gate form.

forms.name: Green Building Submittal for LEED or GreenPoint Rated Projects
forms.applies_to: Projects meeting LEED or GreenPoint Rated standard

triggers.description: Required when Attachment A Table 1 designates LEED or GreenPoint Rated standard based on occupancy, size, and construction type

forms.note: Use when project is required or elects to pursue LEED or GreenPoint Rated certification

forms.name: Green Building Submittal for Other Non-Residential Alterations, Additions & New Construction
forms.applies_to: Non-residential projects NOT required to meet LEED standard

triggers.description: Non-residential projects where Attachment A Table 1 does not require LEED or GreenPoint Rated. Covers Locally Required Measures compliance.
triggers.includes: First-time commercial tenant improvements of any size must comply with applicable CALGreen

new_large_commercial_interior.description: First-time tenant improvement in area >= 25,000 sqft must meet SFGBC Section 5.103.4 standards regardless of building construction date

all_smaller_commercial_ti.description: Commercial TI < 25,000 sqft must comply with all applicable CALGreen requirements

forms.note: Catch-all for non-residential projects not on a rating system path

forms.name: Green Building Submittal for Non-Residential Interior-Only Alteration Projects

triggers.description: Interior-only commercial alterations. Subset of GS-3 scope but specifically for interior-only work.

forms.note: Use for commercial TI projects that are purely interior (no envelope or structural changes)

forms.name: Green Building Submittal for Residential Alteration + Addition Projects

triggers.description: All residential alterations and additions. ADUs (including freestanding) are treated as additions for green building purposes per AB-093.

forms.adu_rule: Construction of a single freestanding ADU accessory to an existing structure is considered an addition. See GS-5 for details.

professional_exemption.description: Green Building Compliance Professional of Record is NOT required for residential alteration/addition projects where:
conditions: Total conditioned floor area increase <= 1,000 sqft
professional_exemption.note: Applicant may complete the green building submittal themselves in these cases

forms.note: Primary form for homeowner renovation and addition projects

forms.name: Green Building Submittal for Municipal Projects
forms.applies_to: City and County of San Francisco municipal projects

triggers.description: Any project authorized by any department of the City and County of San Francisco, including leasehold improvements where the City is a tenant
triggers.required_certification: LEED Gold (per SF Environment Code Chapter 7)

forms.compliance_method: Must use Method 1 only (registration and certification under LEED)
forms.note: Municipal projects >= 10,000 sqft must achieve LEED Gold. Only actual LEED certification is acceptable — no self-verification.

selection_rules.question: Is this a Site Permit application?
Is this a municipal project >= 10,000 sqft?
Is this a residential alteration or addition (including ADU)?
Is this project required to meet LEED or GreenPoint Rated per Attachment A Table 1?
Is this a non-residential interior-only alteration?

rating_system_requirements.description: Which green building rating system standard applies, per Attachment A Table 1, based on occupancy, project size, and new construction vs alteration.

leed_or_greenpoint_required.description: New residential construction meeting size thresholds per Attachment A Table 1
leed_or_greenpoint_required.note: 2022 SFGBC recognizes GreenPoint Rated v.9 and all LEED v4 rating systems, plus more recent versions

leed_required.description: New non-residential construction meeting size thresholds per Attachment A Table 1

major_alteration_definition.description: Major Alteration to Existing Building under SFGBC Sections 5.103.3 or 4.103.3
criteria: Significant upgrade to structural system (30%+ of tributary area altered)
Significant upgrade to one or more of: mechanical, electrical, and/or plumbing systems
Area of more than 25,000 gross sqft
Group B, M, or R occupancy
major_alteration_definition.structural_threshold: 30% or more of the area of proposed construction — areas tributary to vertical load carrying components (joists, beams, columns, walls) that are removed, added, or altered

residential_major_alteration.description: Major alterations to residential buildings may use alternate rating systems
recognized_systems: LEED for Building Design and Construction

locally_required_measures_only.description: Projects not meeting LEED or GreenPoint Rated thresholds must still comply with all locally required measures
applies_to: Small new construction not meeting rating system thresholds
Additions and alterations not meeting major alteration criteria
Non-residential projects not required to meet LEED

compliance_methods.description: Five methods for documenting green building compliance. Methods 1-4 available for rating-system-required projects; Method 5 for locally-required-measures-only projects.

methods.name: LEED Registration + Certification
methods.description: Register with and submit for LEED certification. Provide documentation showing project meets appropriate LEED certification requirements.
methods.note: Only method allowed for municipal projects

methods.name: GreenPoint Rated Registration + Certification
methods.description: Register with and achieve GreenPoint Rated status from Build It Green.

methods.name: LEED or GreenPoint Standards Without Certification
methods.description: Document compliance with LEED or GreenPoint Rated standards without registering or certifying. Green Building Compliance Professional of Record must verify.

methods.name: Alternate Rating System or Equivalency
methods.description: Use another rating system or equivalency as approved by the Director. Requires AB-005 equivalency process.

methods.name: Locally Required Measures Only
methods.description: Submit documentation of compliance with locally required measures in effect at time of permit submittal.
methods.applies_when: Neither LEED nor GreenPoint Rated is required

green_building_compliance_professional.description: Requirements for the Green Building Compliance Professional of Record — required for Methods 3, 4, and 5.

qualifications.base_requirement: License or registration as an Architect or Engineer

specialized_knowledge.leed_projects: LEED accreditation + successful completion of at least one LEED certified project
specialized_knowledge.greenpoint_projects: GreenPoint Rater designation, or team includes a GreenPoint Rater
specialized_knowledge.locally_required_measures_only: Any of: ICC Certified CalGreen Inspector, GreenPoint Rater designation, LEED accreditation, or equivalent approved by Director

exemptions.condition: Residential alteration/addition < 25,000 sqft AND increases conditioned floor area by no more than 1,000 sqft
exemptions.result: Green Building Compliance Professional of Record is NOT required — applicant may complete the submittal
exemptions.exception: Major alterations to residential (project area >= 25,000 sqft with significant structural + MEP upgrade) still require professional or certification

responsibilities: Personally review and verify compliance with SFGBC requirements
Directly supervise persons providing on-site review or verification
Sign Attachment E (Final Compliance Verification) for Methods 3 and 4
Provide verification to DBI that all green building design and construction requirements are met

energy_compliance.description: Energy compliance guidelines specific to green building context (detailed Title 24 rules in title24-energy-compliance.json).
energy_compliance.general_rule: All building permit submittals must show compliance with the California Building Energy Efficiency Standards (Title 24 Part 6) in effect at time of permit submittal, PLUS any compliance margin required by the applicable rating system.

leed_bdc_projects.requirement: Standard Title 24 Part 6 documentation using CEC-approved software
leed_bdc_projects.note: LEED BD+C v4 and LEED CS v4 minimum energy efficiency requirements are LESS strict than CA 2013-2022 Title 24 Part 6 Energy Standards

ashrae_90_1_option.description: When ASHRAE 90.1 option in LEED v4 is used for voluntary energy points
ashrae_90_1_option.requirement: Supporting analysis must include detailed accounting of ALL on-site building energy use: exterior/security lighting, elevators, process loads, receptacle loads
ashrae_90_1_option.documentation: Must include all information required for LEED certification by Green Building Certification Institute

dual_requirement: Comply with California Energy Efficiency Standards (Title 24 Part 6) in effect on date of permit application
Meet minimum energy performance requirements of the applicable green building rating system
leed_homes_and_greenpoint.consistency_rule: Simplest approach: use a single simulation run so compliance run number is consistent throughout documentation

all_electric_mandate.applies_to: All initial applications for new building construction filed on or after June 1, 2021
all_electric_mandate.scope: All space-conditioning, water heating, cooking, and clothes drying must be all-electric
all_electric_mandate.prohibited: Installation of infrastructure, piping systems, or piping for distribution of natural gas or propane to such uses indoors or outdoors
all_electric_mandate.exception: Limited installation of gas piping for commercial food preparation, or if all-electric is determined to be physically or technically infeasible
all_electric_mandate.residential_prescriptive_note: Residential all-electric buildings demonstrating prescriptive compliance may apply GreenPoint Rated J5.1 Option Two: All Electric Compliance with applicable CF1R or NRCC report

construction_site_runoff.leed_required_projects: Must prepare erosion and sedimentation control plan per LEED Sustainable Sites Prerequisite 1 at minimum
construction_site_runoff.all_projects_note: More stringent local requirements may apply regardless of LEED applicability

post_construction_stormwater.trigger_combined_sewer: Projects disturbing >= 5,000 sqft of ground surface
post_construction_stormwater.trigger_separate_sewer: Projects creating or replacing >= 2,500 sqft of impervious surface
post_construction_stormwater.requirement: Stormwater Control Plan submitted to SFPUC for approval

water_efficient_irrigation.trigger: Projects with >= 500 sqft of new or modified landscape
water_efficient_irrigation.note: Stricter than both CALGreen landscape measures (Title 24 Part 11) and California AB 1881 MWELO

mixed_occupancy.description: For mixed occupancy buildings where a rating system is required, the project sponsor may apply a single rating system to the entire building.
mixed_occupancy.requirement: Each portion of the building must meet the Local Requirements applicable to that occupancy.

demolition_replacement.description: Replacement buildings on sites where buildings were demolished after the effective date of the ordinance
demolition_replacement.rule: Planning Department confirms applicable green building requirements during permit review per Attachment A Table 2

historic_buildings.ceqa_determination: Planning Department determines whether building is an 'historic resource' under CEQA
historic_buildings.california_historical_building_code: Buildings qualified to use CA Historical Building Code may apply alternate provisions. Separate DBI determination from Planning's CEQA review.
historic_buildings.feature_retention_credit: Projects retaining, rehabilitating, or repairing significant historical architectural features may receive credit toward green building requirements per Attachment A Table 3
historic_buildings.qualification: Buildings on federal/state/local adopted lists or surveys, or determined by City to be eligible

adu.description: Accessory Dwelling Units — green building treatment
adu.within_existing: ADU within existing structure or attached = alteration or addition
adu.freestanding: Single freestanding ADU accessory to existing structure = treated as addition for green building compliance

new_large_commercial_interiors.description: First-time tenant improvement work in area >= 25,000 sqft must meet green building standards
new_large_commercial_interiors.smaller_ti_note: All first-time commercial tenant interior work < 25,000 sqft must comply with all applicable CALGreen requirements; see Attachment B Table 3 or GS-3

final_compliance.form: Attachment E — Green Building: Final Compliance Verification
final_compliance.timing: Must be submitted prior to final inspection

methods.description: LEED certification documentation from Green Building Certification Institute
GreenPoint Rated certificate from Build It Green
Green Building Compliance Professional of Record signs Attachment E
Professional signs Attachment E + documentation of approved AB-005 equivalency approach

temporary_certificate_of_occupancy.condition: May be issued pending final compliance certification
temporary_certificate_of_occupancy.restriction: No final Certificate of Completion until Attachment E has been received, reviewed, and accepted by DBI

quality_assurance.description: All projects subject to comprehensive review by DBI or its agents
quality_assurance.record_keeping: Project sponsors must maintain comprehensive records for verification
quality_assurance.third_party_certification: LEED or GreenPoint Rated certified buildings generally accepted as fully compliant
quality_assurance.discretion: DBI may review any aspect of green building projects

failure_to_comply.consequence: Subject to all enforcement and abatement remedies in the SF Building Code

equivalency_process.reference: Administrative Bulletin AB-005 (Procedures for Approval of Local Equivalencies)
equivalency_process.when: Project sponsors wishing to propose alternates or equivalencies for SFGBC requirements
equivalency_process.submission_timing: May be submitted with initial permit application or later
requirements: Proposed approach — each alternate presented separately
Complete analysis of Green Building Code and other code-related issues
Recommended by and signed by Green Building Compliance Professional of Record
Calculations or documentation for each specific element confirming proposal meets or exceeds applicable requirements
process: May request review by other City staff or professionals (project sponsor pays)
DBI issues decision to approve, deny, or require modifications
equivalency_process.appeal_path: Deputy Director -> Director -> appeal bodies per SF Building Code
equivalency_process.continuing_requirements: State and local requirements continue to apply regardless: CALGreen (Title 24 Part 11), SFPUC Stormwater Management Ordinance, SFPUC Water Efficient Irrigation Ordinance

attachment_inventory.description: AB-093 includes 8 attachments (A through H) plus GS forms. Attachments are referenced throughout the bulletin for detailed requirements.

attachments.title: Summary of Requirements
attachments.purpose: Master lookup table — determines which green building standard (LEED, GreenPoint Rated, or Locally Required Measures Only) applies based on occupancy, project size, and new construction vs alteration

attachments.title: Additional Requirements in Case of Demolition
attachments.purpose: Green building requirements for replacement buildings after demolition

attachments.title: Reduced Requirements for Retention of Significant Historical Architectural Features
attachments.purpose: Credits available for historic feature preservation

attachments.title: Requirements for Projects Meeting a LEED Standard
attachments.purpose: Specific required measures for LEED-track projects

attachments.title: Requirements for Projects Meeting the GreenPoint Rated Standard
attachments.purpose: Specific required measures for GreenPoint Rated-track projects

attachments.title: Requirements for All Non-Residential Projects Not Required to Meet a LEED Standard
attachments.purpose: Locally required measures for non-residential projects

attachments.title: Requirements for Residential Additions and Alterations
attachments.purpose: Locally required measures for residential alterations/additions

attachments.title: Instructions for Green Building Submittals
attachments.purpose: Instructions for completing GS-1 through GS-6 forms

attachments.title: Final Compliance Verification
attachments.purpose: Form signed at project completion to verify all green building requirements met

attachments.title: Recommended Project Implementation Procedures
attachments.purpose: Best practices for implementing green building during construction

attachments.title: Review of Energy Performance Requirements
attachments.purpose: Energy performance benchmarks and review criteria

submittal_checklist_items.description: Green building checklist items that must be included in permit application. At first architectural or superstructure addendum (whichever comes first).
required_items: Completed GS form (GS-1 through GS-6 as applicable)
Checklist incorporated into project plans indicating required green building measures
Checklist must reference location of green building features in submittal documents
Detail of which addendum or document will provide compliance details for each performance measure or credit
submittal_checklist_items.note: Checklist required for ALL applicable projects including where Form 3 or Form 8 is used. GS form may be reformatted to conform to plan submittal size if all required information is provided.

quick_reference.description: Common scenario lookup for GS form selection and green building pathway

scenarios.scenario: Homeowner kitchen/bath remodel under 1,000 sqft addition
scenarios.note: Applicant may self-complete GS-5 if < 25,000 sqft and <= 1,000 sqft added conditioned area

scenarios.scenario: Residential addition over 1,000 sqft conditioned area
scenarios.rating_system: May need LEED or GreenPoint Rated per Attachment A Table 1
scenarios.note: Check Attachment A Table 1 for size thresholds

scenarios.rating_system: Locally Required Measures Only (treated as addition)
scenarios.note: ADUs treated as additions for green building. Professional not required if < 25,000 sqft and <= 1,000 sqft
Must comply with all applicable CALGreen requirements
Full green building standards apply regardless of building age

scenarios.rating_system: LEED or GreenPoint Rated if thresholds met, otherwise Locally Required Measures
scenarios.note: Use GS-2 if rating system required, GS-3 if not. Also file GS-1 if Site Permit.
Only Method 1 (actual LEED certification) is acceptable

scenarios.scenario: Major alteration to existing building (Group B/M/R, > 25,000 sqft, structural + MEP upgrade)
scenarios.rating_system: LEED or GreenPoint Rated per SFGBC 5.103.3 / 4.103.3
scenarios.note: Must meet 30% structural threshold + MEP upgrade to qualify as major alteration

scenarios.scenario: New residential construction (all-electric required since June 2021)
scenarios.gs_form: GS-1 (if Site Permit) + GS-2 or GS-5
scenarios.rating_system: Per Attachment A Table 1 + AB-112 all-electric mandate
scenarios.note: All new buildings must be all-electric per AB-112. Also requires Title 24 Part 6 compliance.
